title: Relative cycle
summary: In algebraic geometry, a relative cycle is a type of algebraic cycle on a scheme. In particular, let X {\displaystyle X} be a scheme of finite type over a Noetherian scheme S {\displaystyle S} , so that X → S {\displaystyle X\rightarrow S} . Then a relative cycle is a cycle on X {\displaystyle X} which lies over the generic points of S {\displaystyle S} , such that the cycle has a well-defined specialization to any fiber of the projection X → S {\displaystyle X\rightarrow S} .(Voevodsky & Suslin 2000)
